alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Geneva; Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 02 at 8:29AM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama, including the following areas, Coffee, Dale, Geneva, Henry and Houston and Florida, including the following areas, Calhoun, Central Walton, Coastal Bay, Coastal Gulf, Gadsden, Holmes, Inland Bay, Inland Franklin, Inland Gulf, Jackson, Liberty, North Walton, South Walton and Washington. * WHEN...Through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 AM CST, many areas from Bay County through Gulf, Calhoun and Liberty Counties had already gotten 2 to 5 inches of rain. Any additional rainfall will lead to runoff issues and isolated flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
